summary: This is an email chain from August 10, 2019, discussing the official Bureau of Prisons statement announcing the death of Jeffrey Epstein. It shows internal FBI and DOJ coordination regarding the public response to Epstein's apparent suicide at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The deceased inmate found unresponsive in his cell at MCC New York, who was under pretrial status for sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy.

persons.name: Geoffrey Berman
persons.role: U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York (USANYS)
persons.context: The U.S. Attorney who forwarded the official BOP statement about Epstein's death to the FBI.

connections.description: Berman, as U.S. Attorney for SDNY, was involved in the prosecution of Epstein and coordinated the public response to his death.

events.title: Jeffrey Epstein found unresponsive in cell
events.description: At approximately 6:30 a.m., inmate Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell in the Special Housing Unit at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York from an apparent suicide.

events.title: Epstein arrives at MCC New York
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein arrived at the Metropolitan Correctional Center under pretrial status after being indicted for sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, New York
Special Housing Unit at MCC New York
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at approximately 6:30 a.m. on August 10, 2019, at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.
The incident was described as an 'apparent suicide' in the Special Housing Unit.
Epstein was transported to a local hospital where he was pronounced dead.
The FBI is investigating the incident.
Epstein had arrived at MCC New York on July 6, 2019, under pretrial status for sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy.
